movies.title: Gun Crazy: Episode 1 - A Woman from Nowhere

biography.bio: Ryôko Yonekura was born on August 1, 1975 in Yokohama, Japan. She is an actress, known for Doctor X (2012), Gun Crazy: Episode 1 - A Woman from Nowhere (2002) and The Negotiator: The Movie (2010).
biography.name: Ryôko Yonekura

biography.bio: Shingo Tsurumi was born on December 29, 1964 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and writer, known for Shin Godzilla (2016), Dead or Alive (1999) and Kamen Rider Fourze (2011).
biography.name: Shingo Tsurumi

biography.bio: Takeshi Yamato is an actor, known for Tokarefu (1994), Tekken (1990) and Black Angel Vol. 2 (1999).
biography.name: Takeshi Yamato

biography.bio: Shun Sugata was born on February 17, 1955 in Yamanashi, Japan as Masamichi Shibuya. He is an actor, known for Kill Bill: Vol. 2 (2004), Kill Bill: Vol. 1 (2003) and The Last Samurai (2003).
biography.name: Shun Sugata

biography.bio: Takashi Ukaji was born on August 15, 1962 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Legends of the Dark King: A Fist of the North Star Story (2008), Ken 1 - L'ère de Raoh (2006) and 20th Century Boys 1: Beginning of the End (2008).
biography.name: Takashi Ukaji

biography.bio: Kenny Scott is a versatile jet-setting thespian whose star is quickly on the rise. His journey through the entertainment industry has been as eclectic as it has been promising. Furthermore, Kenny has established himself as a sought-after actor/model in Tokyo, Japan with aspirations to transcend his career internationally. While growing up in Buffalo, New York, Kenny dreamed of being an architect and attended Hutchinson Central Technical High School (Hutch Tech) where he studied Building Design. During that time he excelled at cross country and track, was a member of the National Honors Society and the Kappa Sigma Phi Fraterninty, and by his senior year in 1996 he earned many honors for school service, athletics, as well as an award for 4-year perfect attendance. When he decided to attend Union College (Schenectady, New York), Kenny changed direction and majored in History and later pursued a minor in Studio/Visual Arts. Kenny continued to run cross country and after finishing the 1998 season he went on a term abroad. At his host college, Bond University in Queensland, Australia, he met people from all over the world but struck up a special friendship with an Australian student who would later urge him to travel to Japan to teach English. Kenny arrived in Japan in January 2001, with modest goals - learn Japanese, work for a year, and then return back to New York. However, he found that his looks would take him in yet another direction. A fellow in his Japanese class asked him if he had thought about modeling, saying the agencies in Tokyo were always searching for a "foreign" look. On his day off, Kenny visited eight or nine freelance agencies, and within a week had his first job, portraying a runner in a documentary being made about the 1964 Olympics in Japan. Since his adventure began 14 years ago, Kenny has participated in fashion shows, posed for numerous commercials and ads, appeared on CD covers, did music videos, and portrayed various characters on Japanese TV dramas and movies. Despite being in demand and his busy schedule, Kenny has managed to take some time off to partake in his favorite diversion - international travel. He has enjoyed his globe-trotting lifestyle in various parts of the world including Vietnam, Austria, Hong Kong, London, and more recently, Turkey. Kenny's looks, creativity, diverse background, and passion for his career is what sets him a part - and makes him an exciting talent to keep an eye out for.
biography.name: Kenny Scott

biography.bio: Lana Lesley is an actress, known for Gun Crazy: Episode 1 - A Woman from Nowhere (2002), Lost Universe (1998) and Holy Hell (2009).
biography.name: Lana Lesley

biography.bio: Michael Hoffer was born on August 9, 1976 in San Antonio, Texas, USA. He is an actor, known for Chickenfüt (2007), Gun Crazy: Episode 1 - A Woman from Nowhere (2002) and Petite Princess Yucie (2002).
biography.name: Michael Hoffer

biography.bio: Born in Virginia, USA to a military family. Father was Irish Naval Corman in the Vietnam War, English instructor at Sophia University in Japan and mother was Japanese, Daughter of Buddhist Priest. Raised in Italy, Philippines, and Japan and moved to USA and attended University at the University of Texas at Austin. Graduated with BFA in Studio Art and BA in Art History. Is a classically trained Animator through ex Don Bluth and Disney Animator. Began Animating in 1998. Has taught Animation at various locations and has run a personally owned animation school for two years. Has worked with Little Wolf Entertainment Inc and with HorseBack Salad Entertainment as an Animator for clients such as Warner Brothers, Southwestern Airlines, Mattel Interactive, Hannah Barbara, and various others. Most notable work is for Japanese animations translated into English for the Austin, Texas branch of AD Vision Films called Monster Island Studios. She works as Animator, translator, and Voice Actress for various films and has made guest appearances at various animation conventions across the USA.
biography.name: Samantha Inoue Harte
